definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate
to gather up/to collect/to edit/to compile
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: Particularly in the News of the World, this was a newsroom out of control.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是《世界新聞報》，那裏的新聞編輯室已經失控。

sentences.english: Next, they are presented to the owners and to delegates from the newsroom.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，他們需要面對報紙的新老闆和編輯室的代表。

sentences.english: He never even came into the editing room.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至都沒有進過編輯室。

sentences.english: In larger newsrooms, an executive producer supervises the work of the producers.
sentences.chinese: 在大型新聞編輯室，總製作人領導多個製作人的工作。

sentences.english: Al-Jazeera's one of the editorial rooms.
sentences.chinese: 半島電視臺的一處編輯室。

sentences.english: Broadcast newsrooms are not organized like newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 廣播電視臺新聞編輯室的組成與報社不同。

definition: East China Normal University/abbr. for 華東師範大學|华东师范大学[Hua2 dong1 Shi1 fan4 Da4 xue2]

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Zuo4 jia1 Xie2 hui4

definition: (Tw) teacher in charge of a class/homeroom teacher
